message: I'm migrating a Rails app from Ruby 1.8.7 + Rails 2.3.8 to Ruby 1.9.2 + Rails 3
It's already working in Rails3+Ruby1.8.7 and now I'm migrating the Ruby version. Any good resources on the breaking changes in Ruby 1.9.2?
the biggest issue is encoding clashes, but rails should handle that for you, then I would say string character iteration. str[0] => 24  in 1.8 but "a" in 1.9
Then there's always Sam Ruby's presentation: http://slideshow.rubyforge.org/ruby19.html#2
I started this some time ago : http://redmine.ruby-lang.org/projects/ruby-19/wiki/MigrationIssuesFrom18

I'm assuming the Eigenclass blog on the differences is too verbose, but it really is one of the more complete (most?) references on it that I could find: http://eigenclass.org/hiki/Changes+in+Ruby+1.9
Just found this on @drnic's Twitter stream. https://github.com/cldwalker/one9
This appears to be very similar to python's 2to3 program
I've found some things like, {}.to_s is no longer the empty string
MyModule.constants is now a list of symbols rather than a list of strings.
